result.execSummary:
The defendant Cain M Botello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or ammunition. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Straight time. Court stayed commencement until 11/20/2015 by 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cain M Botello

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 2 days condition time at the House of Corrections, straight time.  Court stayed commencement until 11/20/2015 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or ammunition. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Sentence Referral Form

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests motion hearing date.  Defense motions due 09/17/2015, state's reply due 10/01/2015.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a plea hearing, however Defense is still awaiting additional discovery and unable to enter a plea on this date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 22.   Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Written and signed motion of the defense counsel for attorney Cimpl-Wiemer to withdraw granted by the Court. Attorney Essling now attorney on record. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed, Stipulation for Substitution of Attorney.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Branch 15.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms. Written order received and filed.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cain M Botello in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
